abstract: A table last Sunday with a report on executive pay referred incorrectly to equity holdings of Michael L. Eskew, chief executive of United Parcel Service. Their total value, though listed at $535,010,884, included $514.5 million in shares he does not own; they are held in trusts he helps to control on behalf of the company. He owned $17.7 million in shares outright.

lead_paragraph: An article last Sunday with a report on executive pay about exit packages for ousted chief executives misstated a salary equivalent of the average severance in 2006. That average, $9 million, was equivalent to about 170 weeks of salary for each year, not each week, at the helm.

headline.main: Correction: Has the Exit Sign Ever Looked So Good?
